shortcuts.details: Open a new window
Opens a new tab
Opens a new window in incognito mode
Opens a file from your computer
Opens a link in a new tab in the background
Opens a link in a new tab and switches to it
Opens a link in a new window
Reopens the last tab that you closed

shortcuts.shortcut: Drag a tab out of the tab strip
shortcuts.details: Opens the tab in a new window

shortcuts.shortcut: Drag a tab out of the tab strip and into an existing window
shortcuts.details: Opens the tab in the existing window
Switch to the next tab
Switch to the previous tab
Closes the current tab or pop-up
Closes the current window

shortcuts.shortcut: Click and hold either the Back or Forward arrow in the browser toolbar
shortcuts.details: Displays your browsing history in the tab
Goes to the previous page in your browsing history for the tab
Goes to the next page in your browsing history for the tab

shortcuts.shortcut: ⇧ + click + button at top of window
shortcuts.details: Maximises the window
Minimises the window
Hides Google Chrome
Hides all other windows
Quits Google Chrome
Toggles the bookmarks bar on and off
Opens the bookmark manager
Opens the Settings page
Opens the History page
Opens the Downloads page
Opens the Clear Browsing Data dialogue
Switch between multiple users

shortcuts.shortcut: Type a search term, then press Enter
shortcuts.details: Performs a search using your default search engine

shortcuts.shortcut: Type a search engine keyword, press Space, type a search term and press Enter
shortcuts.details: Performs a search using the search engine associated with the keyword

shortcuts.shortcut: Begin typing a search engine URL, press Tab when prompted, type a search term and press Enter
shortcuts.details: Performs a search using the search engine associated with the URL

shortcuts.shortcut: Type a URL and press ⌘ + Enter
shortcuts.details: Opens the URL in a new background tab
Highlights the URL
Places a '?' in the address bar. Type a search term after the question mark to perform a search using your default search engine
Moves your cursor to the preceding key term in the address bar
Moves your cursor to the next key term in the address bar
Highlights the preceding key term in the address bar
Highlights the next key term in the address bar
Deletes the key term that precedes your cursor in the address bar

shortcuts.shortcut: Select an entry in the address bar drop-down menu with your keyboard arrows, then press ⇧ + Fn + Delete
shortcuts.details: Deletes the entry from your browsing history, if possible

shortcuts.shortcut: Press Page Up or Page Down in the addess bar menu
shortcuts.details: Selects the previous or next entry in the menu
Prints your current page
Opens the Page Setup dialogue
Saves your current page
Emails your current page
Reloads your current page
Stops loading of your current page
Opens the find bar
Finds the next match for your input in the find bar

shortcuts.shortcut: ⌘ + ⇧ + G or ⇧ + Enter
shortcuts.details: Finds the previous match for your input in the find bar
Uses selection for find
Jumps to selection
Opens Developer Tools
Opens the JavaScript Console
Opens the source of your current page
Downloads the target of the link

shortcuts.shortcut: Drag a link to the bookmarks bar
shortcuts.details: Saves the link as a bookmark
Saves your current web page as a bookmark
Saves all open tabs as bookmarks in a new folder
Opens your page in full-screen mode
Enlarges everything on the page
Makes everything on the page smaller
Returns everything on the page to normal size
Opens your home page in your current tab
Scrolls down the web page
Searches the web
Copies highlighted content to the clipboard
Copies the URL of the page that you're viewing to the clipboard
Pastes content from the clipboard
Continue a rebase after resolving conflicts
Deletes the highlighted content and copies it to the clipboard
Reverts your last action
Repeats your last action
Deletes highlighted content and saves it to your clipboard (cut)
Selects all the text on your current page
Opens the Spelling and Grammar dialogue
